Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>### Input:What is an area with no grass where I can get things to sell at a roadside stand? Choices:  A: surface of earth B: rest area C: supermarket D: state park E: garden<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is E<n><n>### Input :I’m a chameleon. I live in Madagascar.<n><n>### Request: What am I?<n>### Explanation: In this task you will be given an input string and asked, “ What am I? ” The string will contain one or more words and may contain punctuation. What will be different about the string is there will be one word that begins with a letter in the string but ends with a different letter than what the string contains. The input string cannot begin or end with the same first or last letter. For example, “ I m a dog ” is not valid as the first letter of “I’m a dog” is the same as the last letter of “dog.” Also, “ I’m a cat ” is not valid as its first and last letter are the same. There is no restriction on how many words can be present. For example, “I’m a cat, fish and frog” is a valid string and would result in “I’m a frog” being what the user gets back in return as it is the only word that begins with “I” and ends with another letter different than “I.”<n><n>The only way a word can end with a different letter than the beginning is if the word has the same first and last letter as the input. For instance, “tell me” and “you are the most important person to me” would work because they match all three requirements. However, “me and my cat” fails as “and” is the same letter as the last letter in the string. If there are no words that meet the third requirement, the string will be returned back to the user.<n><n>I had a lot of fun trying to come up with words that contain the rules.<n><n>### Input  :The word for "eight" in English is "octet."<n><n>### Request  :What number is represented by nine letters?<n><n>### Response : I’ll show you. It is "E-N-G-I-N-E-R". In other words, nine letters is represented by the word "e-n-g-i-n-e-r.” It doesn’t matter in English how you spell the word it is the number of letters that is important. The letter E is the 5th letter of the English alphabet. <n><n>###

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>### Input:Sometimes it felt like being able to pay bills was the only reason he was actively what? Choices:  A: pay debts B: make money C: having money D: making money E: keep house<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input 1:<n>Write a program that is given an int and uses recursion to display "Hello world!" plus that integer times.<n><n>```<n>// input : 8<n>// outputs: Hello world! 80 times<n>```<n><n><n>### Input/Output<n>* The input to this method is a sentence.<n>* The output of this method is a word.<n><n><n>### Data Type:<n>* This method takes a string from the keyboard.<n>* This method returns the same type as the input parameter.<n><n><n>## Solution<n>```java<n>public class Main {<n><n>    public static void main(String[] args) {<n><n>        int count;<n>        int total = 80;<n>        System.out.println(count);<n><n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n><n><n>## Solution 2<n>```java<n>public static String print1(int n) {<n>    int total = n;<n>    String[] sentence = {null};<n>    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {<n>        sentence[0] = String.valueOf(i) + " Hello world!";<n>    }<n>    return sentence[0];<n>}<n><n><n>public class Main {   <n>  <n>  public static void main( String[] args ){<n>	  for(int value=0; value<=100; value++){<n>		System.out.println( print1(value) );<n>	  }<n>  }<n>  <n>}<n>```<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>### Input:What would a document be if it is not obtuse? Choices:  A: pointed B: bright C: easy D: clear E: acute angled<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Choice : A - True!<n><n>### Explanation:<n>### Choices:<n>### B - False!<n>I will use some data to explain.<n>### If a shape is obtuse, which means it must have angles that are either more than 90, but not more than 180 OR between.<n>### Example: If you have 2 angles on one side and 2 angles on another, they will add up to more than 18 - 90°.<n>### Angle = (2x90 + 120)<n>### Angle + (2x90)<n>### 1 + (2x9)<n>### 3x9<n>### 27 units<n>### What about the ones on the other side?<n>### 120 + 2x90<n>### 40 + 2x7<n>### 22 + 2x7 (because 7x8 is now 56)<n>### 28 + (2x7)<n>### 44 + 2x7 = 98 units total<n>### 98 units total > 18 units<n>### Thus the shape was not obtuse.<n>### I will now use the obtuse formula to calculate this using obtuse angles.<n>### if a shape is acute:<n>Angles < 90°<n>### Example: a square.<n>### Square: (a 2x2)<n>4 sides = 2+2+2+2 = 8<n>4 angle is < 90° because 90 ° = 3x3, which is larger than 4<n><n>### What about right triangles?<n>A square is a right triangle because the base = 2 and height = 1.<n>### Angles:<n>### Angle A: 3x90 = 270º (two 90° angles equal 180°)<n>### Angles B:  2x90 = 180º<n>### Angle of the whole triangle: 270 + 180 = 450º<n>### Since we already have 4 angles, this means that all 4 angles must equal 450 or

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>### Input:He had a hard time finding the room on his schedule, it was on the second floor and he got lost in the very large what? Choices:  A: school B: office building C: house D: hotel E: centre<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Note:<n>Explanation:The question is asking how many candies Corey has, and so we are counting his candies separately. Because we know that Tapanga has more candies than Coreys, we subtract them from that number and then count what’s remaining. The number left over does not include Tapanga’s candies so adding up theirs will not work.

It is important that you ask for clarification if you are unsure of what the test writer said. Clarification is necessary to help you understand the next problem.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>### Input:Someone who doesn't care about about someone else and wishes them to fail has what feeling towards them? Choices:  A: unfeeling B: negligence C: antipathy D: indifferent E: rapport<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct choice is option C: antipathies. We can find this in the dictionary.<n><n>### Input:"The coder worked on the code for three hours. Then she went to the grocery store to get a snack. She waited in line for three minutes. She finally reached the counter. The cashier took the money for the food, the coder paid the cashier, and then the coder grabbed the snack and was finally able to leave the store." The coder spent a certain amount of time in line and waiting in line. She also grabbed a snack. Do you think the coder spent more time waiting in line?<n><n>### Response<n>The coder spends less time waiting in line. We can find this information by solving for the unknown time. The coder spent 10 minutes at the grocery store, which she subtracted from 3 hours. Therefore, she spent 2 hours on the code, not just 3 hours. We can also read through the story and notice the cashier took the bill, so the coder actually does not wait at the cashier.<n><n>###Input:The amount of hours students had to get their homework done was the same as how many hours they spent on getting their homework done. Therefore the amount of time students had to get their work done subtracted from how much time they spent on getting their work done was equal to zero. How long did it take students to get their homework?<n><n>###Response:<n>The answer is 3 hours. Because the amount of time students spent getting their work done was the same amount of time they had to get their work, then they got their homework done in the same amount of time. This is true because we are subtracting from one quantity until it equals zero. If students got their homework done faster than they were allotted (by subtracting the amount of time they were allotted from the amount of homework time they had), then the answer would have been a negative number.<n><n>###Note: The amount of time to get work done is NOT positive. It has to be zero! Then, the amount of time spent should be compared to how much time is allotted rather than subtracting zero from it.<n><n>###Instruction:Complete the task<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input:There were 16 people

Answer: " + command + "*2")<n>        else:<n>            print("Input : " + command)<n>            print("Output = " + command.capitalize() + "Hours")<n>        return<n><n>    if len(str(command)) == 5:<n>        #Input : run 2h30<n>        if len(command) < 2:<n>            print("Error: Input must have 3 digits")<n>            return<n>        else:<n>##            print("Input : ",command," run ",command)<n>##            print("Output = ",command)<n>            if int(command)!= int(command)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>### Input:What were southern institutions where slaves do the labor called? Choices:  A: farm B: ancient rome C: history book D: poor countries E: plantation<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### 1A:<n>If we assume the answer is A, then we have to determine if it is the whole answer or part of the question.<n>We can solve this by splitting the question into two separate sentences.<n><n>Input:Tapanga and Corey. However, Tapangu has 8 more candiess then Corey. How many does Corey have? Answer: 29<n>- Question is asking for the number of candies Corey have<n>- The answer is 29<n><n>This shows us that we need to go the second option B<n><n>### 2B:<n>If we assume that the entire question is the answer, then we need to determine which of the listed choices is the answer.<n><n>Choices: Choices: A: farm B: Ancient Rome C: History Book D: Poor countries E: Plantaion<n>- Question asks for slavery plantation and the answer is E<n><n>this shows us that the answer Choice is E not the entire question<n><n>### 3C:<n>If we assume we have not enough information to answer the question, then the answer will be None<n>To eliminate choices we must determine if we know if any of the listed choices contain the answer to the question.<n><n>Choises: A: farm B, Ancient Rome C, History Book D, Poor Countries E. Plantation<n>- The question asks about slavery and the answer is E. A and C do not have anything to do with slavery so the answer is not one of them. B is ancient rome which is not the topic. D is about poor countries and plantation is not part of poverty and the answer is not D. The final answer is E. Plantation<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>### Input:What could fighting inflation cause if it is not successful? Choices:  A: problems B: not noticeable C: deflation D: economic instability E: eat cake<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Choice:<n>---<n><n>### Input to the task<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>---<n><n>## Your Code<n><n>```python<n><n>import random<n>num = 3<n>answer = 1<n>while num <= 10:<n>  num = int(random.random() * 10) + 1<n>  myString = "While the question" + num + " is greater than 0, print the answer."<n>  print(myString)<n>  if num>=2:<n>    answer = answer + 1<n>  if num>=3:<n>    answer = (answer + 2) / 3<n>  if num>=4:<n>    if num%4==0:<n>      answer = (answer +2) / 4<n><n>answer = str(answer)+" "<n>print(answer)<n>```<n><n>### Your code above is not quite correct yet. Take a look below.<n><n>###  Solution<n>```python<n><n>def main():<n>    num = 0<n>    num_answer = 0<n>    myString = "Whether or not the question "<n>    while num < 10:<n>        num = num + 1<n>        myString = myString + str(num)<n>        if num >= 2:<n>            num_answer = num_answer + 1<n>        if num >=3:<n>            num_ansers = (num_answer +2) /3<n>        if num >=4:<n>            if num % 4 == 0:<n>                num_answer = (num_average + 2) /4<n>        else:<n>            num_average = (num_answer)<n>```

Choices:  A: watch film B: play cards C: play chess D: read news papers E: surf net<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```JavaScript<n>// A) Watch film<n>if(t = "A")<n>{<n>    alert('you should watch film')<n>}<n><n>// B) play cards <n>if(t = 'B')<n>{<n>    alert("you should play cards")<n>}<n><n>// C.) play chess<n>if(t= 'C')<n>{<n>    answer("you should play chess")<n>}<n><n><n>// D) Read news paper<n>if(t= "D")<n>{<n>    answer('you should read news paper')<n>}<n><n><n><n>// E) Surf net<n>if(t=!E)<n>{<n>    answer"you should surf net"<n>}<n>```<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>### Input:What will happen to your knowledge with more learning? Choices:  A: headaches B: bigger brain C: education D: growth E: knowing more<n><n>### Response:		<n>```php<n><?php<n>$answer = "A";<n>if($answer === "A"){<n>	echo "headache";<n>}if ($answer === "B") {<n>	echo "biggest headache";<n>}if($answer === "C") {<n>	echo  "larger";<n>}if ($question === "D") {<n>	echo larger;<n>}if ($answer  === "E") {<n>echo "knowing more";<n>}<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>### Input:The cloth's are not yet placed where they belong, where should we put them? Choices:  A: linen closet B: kitchen C: on the space heater D: fabric store E: bedroom<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>###### Solution:<n>A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>###### Solution: <n><n>```<n>#!/usr/bin/python<n><n>'''<n>  #include<unistd.h><n>  #include <pwd.h><n>  <n>  int main(int argc, char * argv[])<n>  {<n>    struct passwd *pwd = getpwuid(geteuid());<n>    <n>    printf("myusername is: %s\n", pwd->pw_name);<n>    printf("myuid is: %d\n", pwd? *pwd:??)<n>    return 0;<n>  }<n><n><n>  '''<n>```<n><n># Input:<n><n>```<n><n>Myusername is John<n>Myuid is 1027<n><n>```<n><n>### <n><n><n>### Input<n><n>```<n>#Include <pthread.h><n>#Inlcude <semaphore.h><n>#Include <sys/wait.h><n>int counter =0;<n>int sem[2];<n>void *t1(void*a){<n>    int i;<n>    for(i = 0;i<10;i++)<n>    {<n>		counter++;<n>       <n>		sem_post(sem);<n>	}<n>	sem_wait(sem);<n>}<n>void *t2(void *a){<n>    int  i=0;<n>    for(;;i++){<n>		sem_wait(y);<n>		sem_destroy(sem);<n>		if(counter==10)<n>       	{<n>            wait(1);<n>        	exit(0);<n>		}<n>    }		<n>}<n><n>int main(){<n>	int status;<n>    pthread_t tid[2];<n>	int ret=0;<n>    int i=0;<n>	int x =1;<n>    sem_init(sem,0,2);<n>    ret=pthread_create(&tid[0],NULL,t1,NULL);<n>    sem_destroy(sem);     <n>    ret=pThread_create(&tid[1],NULL, t2,NULL);<n>    printf("%d",i);<n>    i++;<n>    exit(0);<n>}<n>```<n>

Choices: A: current assets, B: current liabilities, C: net cash flow, D: working capital, E: fixed assets<n><n>### Response :B<n><n>### Input  : The term ‘crowdovers’ defines: Choices: A.  an individual who purchases a house and builds a new home on the property.  B. An individual who will become the owner of a large piece of land, while renting it out to people. C. An individual who will build several homes to sell on a piece of land. D. An individual who purchases a small house when renting will be available.<n>Answer: C<n><n>### Input   : Which of the following is NOT included in depreciation charges? Choices:  a. Increases in the fair value of plant and equipment b. Increases in depreciation on account receivables due to inflation. C. Increases in maintenance costs of property, plant and equipment. D. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>### Input:The man needed to buy flooring, where was he looking for it? Choices:  A: walmart B: loft C: house D: home depot E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>```<n><n>### Instructions: Write multiple choice questions and corresponding answers using JavaScript, as shown in the example code below in this workshop.<n>```<n><n>## Explanation<n>1. The prompt describes a task. In the task, it gives us data(Tapanga and Corey) and asked us to find out how many candies Corey has.<n>2. So, we do the following operations:<n>    - We add the amount of Tapangu and Corey together(66). Let's call it a total of candies.<n>    - We subtract the amount of Tapanga from the total amount. Since Corey has 8 more candie than Tapanga, we subtract the amount of Tantanga from the total amount(It is 8 in this situation).<n>    - The result of the above operation is 29. Since Tantanga has 29(I mean 29 candies), Corey has 29(Since he has 8 more than Tantanga). Therefore, the answer is 29.<n>3. The instruction above is the task request, which we are expected to complete.<n><n><n>### [Link](https://github.com/d3n87d2/Learning-js-from-scratch3/tree/main/Wk5-A)<n>

She was always at ease when she followed directions. Although the words were simple, there was more at work than meets the eye.
